title: Smog may be getting worse in some cities thanks to Arctic warming
description: Rising temperatures in the Arctic may be weakening winds in China and India, lessening air flow over major cities and exacerbating winter smogs

Manage your subscription here Activate subscription            Smog may be getting worse in some cities thanks to Arctic warming          Environment   26 March 2019     VCG/VCG via Getty By Yvaine Ye  MILDER conditions in the Arctic could be weakening winds in China and India, making winter smogs worse.  Burning fossil fuels can result in severe clouds of pollution in many cities in Asia, including Beijing and Delhi. These smogs – aerosols of fine particles – are worse in winter, when more fuel is used for heating and weather patterns that can cause dirty air to linger tend to take hold.
